metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9050 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
libxml2 20904-GITv2.9.4-16-g0741801 is vulnerable to a heap-based bufferover-read in the xmlDictAddString function in dict.c. This vulnerabilitycauses programs that use libxml2, such as PHP, to crash. This vulnerabilityexists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2016-1839.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9050` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.3
libxml2-utils - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.3
python-libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.3').
